Detailed Description

File implementation for FAT filesystem (FAT) storage devices

Class FatFileImp represents a file stored on a FAT storage device supporting the root file system interface.

See also:
File

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN FatFileImp::Close (   )  [virtual]
 

Closes a previously opened file. An overriding method must call this base implementation at the end of its implementation if the file could be closed successfully to assure that the counter of open files gets set properly.

Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

Implements File.

BOOLEAN FatFileImp::Create (  UINT32  size  )  [virtual]
 

Creates a physical file with path m_path and initial size specified in bytes. The MIME type of the file is implicitly defined by the extension of m_path. The file can only be created if it doesn't exist yet. After the file has been created successfully, the file is opened automatically for contents operations in mode ReadAndWriteMode and its internal file position is set to 0, independent of the size argument. The file grows itself if it is written beyond its actual size. Creating an empty file with size 0 is allowed. For shrinking or growing the file use method Resize(). An overriding method must call this base implementation at the end of its implementation if the file could be created successfully to assure that the counter of open files gets set properly. This is a file operation and of course the file must not be open on call.

Parameters:
size The initial size of the new file.
Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

Implements File.

BOOLEAN FatFileImp::CreateDir (   )  [virtual]
 

Creates a physical directory with path m_path. The last segment of m_path is taken as name of the new directory to create. The directory can only be created if all the directories specified in m_path already exist and the new directory doesn't exist yet. This is a file operation and of course the file must not be open on call.

Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

Implements File.

BOOLEAN FatFileImp::CreateStreaming (   )  [virtual]
 

Creates a physical file with path m_path. The MIME type of the file is implicitly defined by the extension of m_path. The file can only be created if it doesn't exist yet. After the file has been created successfully, the file is opened automatically for contents in streaming mode.

This means that only the methods:

  • WriteStreaming
  • WriteStreamingAsync
  • ReadStreaming
  • ReadStreamingAsync and not the methods Read() or Write() can be used with this file.

Implements File.

Date FatFileImp::DateFromDriverDate (  UINT16  date  )  [inline, static, protected]
 

BOOLEAN FatFileImp::Delete (   )  [virtual]
 

Deletes the file or directory. If the file is actually a directory, then it must be empty in order to be deleted. If the file or directory does not exist the method fails. The method succeeds if and only if the file or directory could successfully be deleted. This is a file operation, the file must not be open on call.

Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

Implements File.

BOOLEAN FatFileImp::GetAccessDate (  Date &  date  )  const [virtual]
 

If the access date of the file is available then date is set to it and TRUE is returned, otherwise FALSE is returned. The file need not be open. Please override this method for storage devices which support retrieving the date of the last file access.

Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

Returns:

BOOLEAN FatFileImp::GetNativeProperty (  UINT  prop_Id,
void *  val
)  const [virtual]
 

Retrieves the native property identified by prop_Id via argument val. If the property is not supported by the native file (and therefore can't be retrieved) the method fails. The properties that the native file supports are defined by the derived class that implements the native file support. E.g., for knowing which properties a flash file supports look at the documentation of class FlashFileImp, there the respective property IDs are defined. It is crucial that the given property ID prop_Id and the receiving value val really match!

Parameters:
prop_Id ID of the native file property to retrieve, defined in the derived class that implements the native file support.
val Valid pointer to the value object that shall be set to the current value of the file property with id prop_Id.
Returns:
Tells if the file property could be retrieved.

Reimplemented from File.

BOOLEAN FatFileImp::GetSize (  UINT32 &  size  )  const [virtual]
 

If the file size can be retrieved then size is set to the actual file size in bytes and TRUE is returned, otherwise FALSE is returned. The file need not be open.

Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

Implements File.

BOOLEAN FatFileImp::Rename (  const WString &  new_name  )  [virtual]
 

Renames the file or directory to new_name. If the file or directory does not exist the method fails. Argument new_name is the file name including the file extension (if any) but without any leading directories. The MIME type of the renamed file is defined by the extension of the new name, if none exists it has general type. If the new name is equal to the old name the method fails. The method succeeds if and only if the file or directory really was renamed. Subclasses have to first check if the new file name is different to the actual one, then physically rename the file, and finally call this base method for changing the name which is controlled within this base class. This base method never fails. For a sample implementation see FlashFileImp::Rename(). This is a file operation, the file must not be open on call.

Parameters:
new_name New name of the file including the file extension (if any). No directory segments are allowed.
Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

Implements File.

BOOLEAN FatFileImp::Resize (  UINT32  new_size,
UINT32  copy_buf_size
)  [virtual]
 

Resizes the file to contain new_size bytes. If the new size is less than the original size then the file is truncated. If the new size is bigger than the original size then the newly created part of the file is not initialized and has to be written to be in defined state. Emptying a file by resizing it to size 0 is allowed. This default implementation uses a temporary file for resizing. Override this method if resizing is explicitly supported by the derived file class. This is a file operation, the file must not be open on call.

Parameters:
new_size The new size of the file.
copy_buf_size The size of the internally used copy buffer, if used at all. The size of this buffer may significantly affect the performance of this operation.
Returns:
Flag indicating success. Please call GetLastError() to get an error code.

Reimplemented from File.

Field Documentation

const UINT FatFileImp::PROP_NATIVEHANDLE = 0 [static]
 

Property ID for the internal FAT handle of type fs_fd_type. Getting this property is only possible if the file is open. Setting this property is not possible.
